message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: String[] tabOfShortString = finalString.split(" ");
int length = tabOfShortString.length;
System.out.println("Length of float string is" + length);
short[] shortsArray = new short[length];
for (int l = 0; l < length; l++) {
    Short res = Short.parseShort(tabOfShortString[l]);
    System.out.println("Indice Short Value is " + res);
    shortsArray[l] = res;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue with your code is that you are using the `new Short()` constructor to convert the string to a Short object. However, this constructor is deprecated and should not be used. Instead, you can use the `Short.parseShort()` method to directly parse the string into a short value. This will accurately capture the string values in your shortsArray.
